data.question: What type of ligand is involved in the novel Cu(I) complexes synthesized?
What is the role of dimetallic copper(II) acetate in the synthesis of complex 1?
data.answer: It is used along with HQ as oxidant and reductant, respectively, for the synthesis of complex 1.

data.question: Is compound 1 soluble in polar organic solvents?
What method is used to elucidate the electronic structure of the complexes?
What is the yield of complex 1 when synthesized?
How are the axial positions of the Cu2 core in complex 1 occupied?
data.answer: By the weakly coordinated oxygen atoms from the neighboring Cu2 units

data.question: Does the synthesis of complex 2 involve the use of chloroform?
What is the role of 4,4‘-bipyridine in the synthesis of complex 3?
data.answer: It acts as a linear bidentate linker.

data.question: Are the alkenic bonds of the BQ ligand in complex 1 longer than that of the free BQ?
What significant feature is observed in the 13C NMR studies of these Cu−BQ complexes?
data.answer: Extremely large upfield shifts of the alkenic carbon atoms of the BQ

data.question: Is the magnetic susceptibility of complex 1 indicative of diamagnetism?
What does the DFT calculation on the model compounds reveal about the HOMO and LUMO?
data.answer: The HOMO is a σ* orbital of the Cu2 core, and the LUMO is an antibonding orbital mainly localized on the π* orbital.

data.question: Are the Cu−BQ complexes synthesized by a redox reaction of a copper−quinonoid pair?
What is the chemical shift of the alkenic carbon atoms of complex 1 in CD3OD?
Does complex 3 contain a one-dimensional coordination chain?
What is the yield of complex 3 when synthesized?
How is the anti-type complex 2 obtained from complex 1?
data.answer: By replacing two bridging acetate anions of 1 with chloride anions.

data.question: Is the molecular structure of complex 2 characterized by a two-dimensional layer?
What enhances the π-back-donation in the BQ ligand of the Cu−BQ complexes?
data.answer: Two electron-withdrawing carbonyl groups on each olefin bond in the BQ ligand.

data.question: Are the upfield shifts for common copper(I)−olefin complexes typically small?
